title: How to get it working after update
text:
Mine stopped working after the update and I followed these steps to get it working again:
1. Delete the app and download the new version from the App Store.
2. Plug in camera, hold reset button for 10 seconds.
3. Connect camera to router via ethernet cable.
4. Open App, tap the menu access (white horizontal bars) at upper left of screen. Tap "camera list".
5. Tap the "add camera" icon at bottom of screen. Proceed with manual setup. You may disconnect ethernet cable and power after setup, move camera to a new location, power up and connect via wifi.
NOTES: 
1. Older cameras can't connect to 5G networks, only slower ones.
2. Each time a screen appears with a password field, you must create or enter a password for your wifi or camera, as appropriate. Camera will not operate until you change the default password (admin) to a new complex password.

title: Rating APP, not camera...
text:
The ability to save a recording from the event list would be nice or take a snapshot of something that was recorded.
Easy to use app.  Camera setup via the app is really easy.  No directions of how to setup recording but not too hard to figure out. (Advanced Settings).  When using sound and presets the screen image gets small to fit the buttons and doesn't go away unless you deselect the option, should be able to hear without  image getting small.  
External, remote recording option would be nice (cloud storage?).
Sound and voice work well but you will of course need someone else to help you test while you are in another room.
Notifications can be annoying in a high trafficked area.  Suggest you only turn those on when no one is supposed to be in the recording area.

title: Video quality is good if it stays connected!
text: As others said, this is a good unit if it stays connected.  I literally have it next to my router and the connection keeps dropping. I'm gonna give it few more weeks to see if an update is coming.  Otherwise this is not a reliable security camera as it may miss critical events due to poor wifi connectivity.  I got it at a discounted price so I can't really expect top quality, but the retail for the BH1826 is $200 which in my opinion is not worth it. title: Not great
text:

After unplugging and moving to permanent resting place I had to reconnect all over again. This time though I was able to find the camera on the network so connecting was faster, but still frustrating to start again. 

Once the camera was connected I was able to pan, tilt, listen, etc. But when I tried push to talk it crashed and I had to reconnect the camera. 

Another thing that would be nice is if you are using sound and you are in full screen landscape, the overlay should disappear. Takes away bottom portion of the screen. This is removed when muted, why should it be different otherwise? 

Also for anyone trying to connect the camera to another app, I was able to find the camera runs on port 81. From there you can have access to an admin panel to see and set advanced settings.
